title: Ten replaces star Masterchef judges
text:
Network Ten has named Jock Zonfrillo, Melissa Leong and Andy Allen as the hosts of Masterchef, replacing star trio Matt Preston, Gary Mehigan and George Calombaris who got the chop following a contract dispute.

The new judges were unveiled at Ten's annual upfronts on Thursday morning, where the CBS-owned free-to-air network outlined its content and strategy for 2020.

Andy Allen, Melissa Leong and Jock Zonfrillo are the new judges on Network Ten's MasterChef.

Mr Zonfrillo is the owner and chef of three-hatted restaurant Orana, and Bistro Blackwood in Adelaide. Ms Leong is a food writer and critic, while Mr Allen was the winner of Masterchef season four.

"Their combined culinary credentials coupled with their passion and sheer joy for food, and their relentless enthusiasm to explore ingredients, preparation and cooking methods ensures we are in for a real treat," said Ten chief content officer Beverley McGarvey.

Mr Preston, Mr Mehigan and Mr Calombaris left Ten in July in a surprise announcement after 11 seasons of Masterchef, one of the network's most successful shows of the 2000s.
description: Network Ten has named the replacements for its star Masterchef trio Matt Preston, Gary Mehigan and George Calombaris.
